About the job

The main duties of this role will be to investigate customers who appear to be sending spam text messages and then work with Twilio's account managers and customers to prevent additional spam.

For context, a relatively small minority of Twilio's customers use Twilio's platform to send spam. Such messages are violations of Twilio's acceptable use policy and are often also violations of US law. Accordingly, Twilio has an obligation to stop such messages. We need to identify customers sending spam so that we can help the customer to prevent additional spam. Then, in cases where the customer cannot or will not stop, we may then need to close the customer's account.

Responsibilities

Specifically, this person would primarily be responsible for the following:


Monitor several business intelligence reports that indicate that a customer may be sending spam
When a customer appears to be sending spam, review that customer's outbound message logs to understand the nature of the content that the customer is sending (e.g., political campaign messages, marketing messages for a particular product)
Review the customer's inbound message logs to (a) assess whether the outbound messages are unwanted and (b) gauge how angry or frustrated message recipients may be
Search the internet for information on the customer to see if there are any complaints of spam or other indicators of the nature of their messages
Assess how message recipients may have opted in to receive messages, looking for deficiencies in the opt-in process
Gather basic information on the customer (e.g., how much the customer is spending, how long the customer has been using Twilio's service)
If the customer appears to be sending spam, then this role would:
Gather the relevant metrics and information into a report
Share the report with the relevant Twilio customer account manager
Work with the Twilio account manager and the customer to address the spam issue by recommending best practices

About us:

Our developers have been contributing code to major organizations and open source projects for over 25 years now. They've also been writing books, speaking at conferences, and helping push software development forward -- changing companies and even industries along the way.

As consultants, we work on-site with our clients to ensure we're delivering the best possible solution. Our Lead Dev plays an important role in leading these projects to success.

Curious what makes a developer a Lead around these parts? A lead is:


Often the day-to-day primary point of contact with our clients
Able to strategically lead a project team to successful delivery
Excited to mentor, influence and lead a team of ThoughtWorkers and clients
An expert in at least one language or domain, and maybe in 2 or more

We believe that to flourish in this role, you're good at:
---------------------------------------------------------

Technical Skills


Architecture. You should be comfortable working with your team to craft a design: choosing the appropriate technology and designing a solution that both answers the problem at hand, and stays within constraints.
Coding. Our Leads never go post-technical. We think that it's important for technical leadership to continue to code. Our clients don't all work in one language or platform, and neither do we. As a lead, we're looking for a breadth of experience in a lot of languages, and expertise in one or two: Java, javascript, and Ruby are high on our list. (Other notables: Python, Scala, .NET, Clojure.) You should also be up to speed on practices like TDD, continuous integration, pairing, and infrastructure automation.
Understanding and often playing a major part in the entire cycle of software consulting and delivery, from ideation, to project conception, to UX, to code, to testing, to deployment, and around again.
Agile. We believe strongly in agile delivery practices, having implemented them for ourselves and our clients for a long time now. You should be very comfortable working with Agile, Lean and Continuous Delivery practices -- and love it as much as we do.

Soft Skills


Mentoring a team and bringing them up to speed on new languages and skills. We all learn from each other, but with the breadth of technical experience you'll bring to the table, you'll be an invaluable teacher to your less-experienced peers.
Thinking big and acting fast. You'll need a startup mentality with enterprise awareness. That means you can manage competing priorities, that you're ready to pivot or adjust plans quickly, and that you understand the role you and your team play in major organizations' tech strategies.
Influencing priorities, for both the team and the client. You understand both the business problem and the technical solution, and you're able to advocate for excellence and effect change when necessary.
Finesse. As consultants, we navigate within our client's organizations to influence big decision makers and win trust. In this job, you'll be using your people skills as much as your coding skills.

And here's some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ThoughtWorks.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


A real commitment to "changing the face of IT" -- our way of thinking about diversity and inclusion. Over the past ten years, we've implemented a lot of initiatives to make ThoughtWorks a place that reflects the world around us, and to make this a welcoming home to technologists of all stripes. We're not perfect, but we're actively working towards true gender balance for our business and our industry, and you'll see that diversity reflected on our project teams and in offices.
Continuous learning. You'll be constantly exposed to new languages, frameworks and ideas from your peers and as you work on different projects -- challenging you to stay at the top of your game.
No pigeon-holing: at ThoughtWorks, there's no applying to new roles. With time, you'll build trust and credibility and move easily into new roles if you're inclined, like trying out life in a QA or BA's shoes.
Miles on miles. As consultants, we travel to the client sites every week. At first, you'll likely travel domestically, but with time, you'll find opportunities to travel around the world (and rack up some major points along the way.)
Support to grow as a technologist outside of your role at ThoughtWorks. This is why ThoughtWorkers have written over 100 books and can be found speaking at (and, ahem, keynoting) tech conferences all over the world. We love to learn and share knowledge, and you'll find a community of passionate technologists eager to back your endeavors, whatever they may be. You'll also receive financial support to attend conferences every year.
An organizational commitment to social responsibility. ThoughtWorkers challenge each other to be just a little more thoughtful about the world around us, and we believe in using our profits for good. All around the world, you'll find ThoughtWorks supporting great causes and organizations in both official and unofficial capacities.

A few important things to know:
-------------------------------


Travel is required. Projects are almost exclusively on customer site, so ThoughtWorkers need to be flexible and up for extensive travel. Most of our consultants travel every week and fly home for weekends. We do our best to take people's personal situations into account, but we know it's not for everyone.
Residing near one of our North America offices in Chicago, Dallas, New York, Atlanta or San Francisco is preferable although not necessary.

Not quite ready to apply? Or maybe this isn't the right role for you?

That's OK, you can stay in touch with AccessThoughtWorks ( https://www.thoughtworks.com/careers/access?utm_source=apply-jobs&utm_medium=jd&utm_campaign=access-thoughtworks ), our learning community (tick 'contact me about recruitment opportunities' to hear about jobs in the future).

About Us:
Launched in 2000 in San Francisco, Hotwire is one of the earliest innovators in the online travel arena. Just a few years later in 2003 we joined the Expedia Group family of brands that includes Hotels.com, HomeAway, Travelocity and more.

Our roots are here in San Francisco, but we also have offices in Seattle along with an important and fast-growing product and technology presence in Gurgaon, India. Hotwire has the energy and pace of a startup, plus the stability and backing of the incredible Expedia family of companies. Hotwire’s culture centers around delivering value to customers and supply partners by being passionate about building great products with the latest and greatest technologies available. We pride ourselves on our organizational transparency, a bias for action and a customer-centric approach to everything we do.

Hotwire differentiates itself as a brand within the travel marketplace by offering a unique a core value proposition for customers and suppliers with our opaque pricing model. This concept revolves around offering great bargains on hotel room nights without sharing the specific name or location of the hotel until the booking is complete. By giving this flexibility to our suppliers, we can offer great value to our customers. Hotwire also offers a full retail suite of other travel products that can fulfill virtually any customer travel need.

We’re currently making substantial investments in our technology platform and our brand marketing strategy to enable our next stage of high growth. To make these endeavors possible, we’re on the hunt for people who are passionate about solving tough problems and are excited about the opportunity take on highly visible roles that will have an immediate impact on our business.

If you thrive in environments that are dynamic, action-oriented, data-driven and relish in conquering diverse challenges every single day, joining Hotwire is likely to be the most rewarding opportunity of your career. So- what are you waiting for? Come join a household name brand that lives at the exciting intersection of technology and travel.

Do you want to make an impact? Would you like to see your work affect people's travel choices in real time?

Berkeley Lab’s Joint Genome Institute Division has an opening for a Staff Software Developer. This position is in JGI’s Sequence Data Management group. The position’s responsibilities will be supporting and enhancing JGI’s JAMO data management system. The position is will be responsible for planned enhancements to better support search, data management/consistency, and allow users to self-services changes to their data as well as address system robustness and backend efficiency. In addition work will need to be done to complete the migration to new systems (Cori) as well as off-site backup options (i.e., Google and/or ORNL) to better provide better support in the case of disaster recovery and to address business continuity issues arising from the utilization of a single site. Additional work that this position covers is the ongoing development of the JGI/KBase partnership and the NCBI/SRA/GenBank submission pipelines with existing and new products (i.e., Methylation data, BAM data, products not supported by GOLD). The position will also support the other members of the data management group in their work on JGI’s current and future sequencing platforms.

What You Will Do:
Produce and manage the sequence data from next-generation sequencers that support global genomic and bio-energy research science
Work with large scale data problems
Work with petabyte range file and tape systems
Be part of the team that works with the world’s fastest computers for computationally intensive projects.
Responsibilities at the Staff Software Developer level include:
Independently maintain software systems that support data transfer between JGI and external organizations.
Design, implement, test, and deploy extensions to high-throughput data management systems.
Create documentation and assist users on our metadata management system.
Develop tools to enables users to access, mine, and research the organization’s metadata.
Develop qualitative and predictive analytics to inform organizational usage policy.
Analyze the impact of process, hardware and software changes on production line performance.
Implement sequence data management, specific user interfaces and reports.
Ensure accurate software version control, testing, and release engineering.
Communicate plans, designs, and progress/status to customers and management; coordinate development work across JGI groups.
Work with internal groups to help them follow JGI’s metadata standards.
Assist with the curation of legacy data files and metadata.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues with new and existing sequence data management systems (e.g., processing errors, software bugs, user and data retrieval requests).
In addition to the above, the Sr. Software Developer responsibilities include:Contribute at a higher level of independence and responsibilities.Perform as a technical lead and key contributor; troubleshoot and solve highly technical, complex problems.Advocate for data management best practices in the organization.

What is Required:
Qualifications (Software Developer 3 level):B.S. in Computer Science or a related scientific/technical field plus typically eight years of related experience, or overall equivalent experience.
In addition to the above, the Sr Software Developer qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science or related field plus a minimum of 12 years of relevant experience, or overall equivalent experience or 8 years and a Master’s degree; or equivalent experience.Proficiency with system and software design/implementation in a scientific or technical environment.Experience troubleshooting complex software issues.Experience with predictive analytics on text or unstructured data.Experience with supervised and unsupervised machine learning methodologies and feature engineering.Proficiency with Python; MySQL or Oracle (or similar); Linux or Unix.Experience developing web user interfaces.Full life-cycle software development experience with the ability to communicate effectively (i.e., understand/define needs and priorities) with scientific and administrative customers.Ability to apply analytical skills and creativity to solve complex software and data management problems.Effective time management, organization, and planning skills.Talent for working well under short deadlines and handling multiple tasks simultaneously.Ability to work effectively in a diverse team environment.

Additional Desired Qualifications:
Git/Bitbucket, NoSQL/MongoDB.
Production software systems support experience.
High performance, parallel computing, and/or grid engines.
Agile and Test-Driven development methodologies.
Design and utilization of interface services (e.g., RESTful).
Demonstrated expertise creating systems and software for processing large volumes of data.
Demonstrated expertise in developing quantitative and predictive analytics from unstructured data.

#LI-NA

Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Where and Why

Who?

Twilio takes something very complex (communications) and makes it look easy, we're looking for a Software Engineer that can do that too! As a member of the Technical Operations Development team you will build solutions that enable Twilions to efficiently and effectively get stuff done! Successful candidates will have experience developing applications in full stack as a member of a collaborative team and has no fear digging in to the unknown.

React and API design is a plus!

What?

Twilio Technical Operations Development works on a plethora of issues, a great day for you would involve proposing solutions and then implementing them in a creative and engaging way. You may work with technologies related to Twilio API's, highly availability, scalability, AWS, but list is too long to include here. You will dive in to new technologies frequently, and expected to only develop on the bleeding edge.

Why?

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications, and we are tasked to do the same. As a Software Engineer your applications will be critical in positioning our products as the most engaging brand in communication. Our wide-ranging use of communications technology offers excellent opportunities for research.

Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. Come join us.

Where?

This position will be located in our beautiful office at 375 Beale Street in San Francisco. You will enjoy our incredible perks: catered meals, snacks, game room, ergonomic desks, massages, Wednesday Night dinners, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate ourvalues ( http://www.twilio.com/values ), who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

About us:
More than 2 million developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, and video by virtualizing the world's telecommunications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers. Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 1,000 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in Bogotá, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Singapore and Tallinn.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

One Degree is a nonprofit technology-driven organization that is revolutionizing the way low-income families access social services and benefits. Our mission is to empower people to create a path out of poverty for themselves and for their communities. We create modern tech-driven solutions that help families find, access, and manage nonprofit and social services.
Thousands of people in the San Francisco Bay Area and Los Angeles County rely on One Degree's core platform on our website (www.1degree.org) and mobile apps (iOS and Android) to access health care, food banks, employment services, and much more. Through One Home (OneHomeBayArea.org), we are working to ensure every family has a safe and stable home by making it easy to find and apply for affordable housing.
We’re a team of 11 full-time staff, with a solid foundation (supported by the Kresge Foundation, Tipping Point Community, Irvine Foundation, Google, Y Combinator, and many others). We are committed to diversity and especially encourage those from underrepresented communities to apply, including but not limited to people of color, LGBTQ community members, people with lived experience in low-income communities, and people with disabilities.
We have a small product development team and we get stuff done. As a Software Engineer at One Degree, you will build and maintain products that help thousands of low-income families find the resources they need to overcome poverty. If this gives you goosebumps, read on.
As a Software Engineer, you will...
develop and improve products and features that directly help low-income and at-risk families
find and squash bugs
coordinate with other engineers to accomplish complex projects
help members directly through light technical support as needed
work in a variety of platforms and frameworks, on the client and server
work with a variety of people, including non-technical stakeholders, low-income families, and other staff
If you...
care deeply about social justice and equity
want to spend your days working on something that matters, helping people in meaningful ways
enjoy working alone (about 80% of the time), but can easily work with others – you will be supported by a team of fellow smart, mission-driven engineers
like to write clean, efficient code that solves real-world problems, not theoretical ones
like the idea of working at a small, flexible, mission-driven nonprofit organization
approach software engineering with humility and an interest in learning
believe your code will improve with input from others
can pass a background check (because you will have access to sensitive user information)
And have...
a BS/BA degree, or equivalent knowledge, in Computer Science or related field
at least 2 years of experience as a software developer, maintaining products for real users
expertise in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
experience with Rails and AngularJS, or similar web frameworks
experience with or an interest in learning iOS/Swift and Android/Java development
experience using Git
experience and an appreciation for writing tests
working knowledge of SQL and MongoDB or similar
Then you should...
submit a brief cover email and resume here by September 14. We actually do read cover letters and want to hear why you think this is the right role for you. Please explain your interest in One Degree specifically when you apply.
send us a link to some of your live work or code

You’ll need to have: 3+ years of development experience Strong knowledge in C/C++, JavaScript and Python Excellent time management and prioritization skills Collaboration Skills We’d love to see: Experience and interest with machine learning libraries Knowledge of search technologies Eagerness to explore and learn If you're interested in joining our team, please submit an application and take a tour of our office ( http://bit.ly/140Tour ).

Our developers have been contributing code to major organizations and open source projects for over 25 years now. They’ve also been writing books, speaking at conferences, and helping push software development forward - changing companies and even industries along the way. As consultants, we work on-site with our clients to ensure we’re delivering the best possible solution. Our Lead Dev plays an important role in leading these projects to success. Curious what makes a developer a Lead around these parts? A lead is: * Often the day-to-day primary point of contact with our clients * Able to strategically lead a project team to successful delivery * Excited to mentor, influence and lead a team of ThoughtWorkers and clients * An expert in at least one language or domain, and maybe in 2 or more We believe that to flourish in this role, you're good at: - Technical Skills * Architecture. You should be comfortable working with your team to craft a design: choosing the appropriate technology and designing a solution that both answers the problem at hand, and stays within constraints. * Coding. Our Leads never go post-technical. We think that it’s important for technical leadership to continue to code. Our clients don’t all work in one language or platform, and neither do we. As a lead, we’re looking for a breadth of experience in a lot of languages, and expertise in one or two: Java, javascript, and Ruby are high on our list. (Other notables: Python, Scala, .NET, Clojure.) You should also be up to speed on practices like TDD, continuous integration, pairing, and infrastructure automation. * Understanding and often playing a major part in the entire cycle of software consulting and delivery, from ideation, to project conception, to UX, to code, to testing, to deployment, and around again. * Agile. We believe strongly in agile delivery practices, having implemented them for ourselves and our clients for a long time now. You should be very comfortable working with Agile, Lean and Continuous Delivery practices - and love it as much as we do. Soft Skills * Mentoring a team and bringing them up to speed on new languages and skills. We all learn from each other, but with the breadth of technical experience you’ll bring to the table, you’ll be an invaluable teacher to your less-experienced peers. * Thinking big and acting fast. You’ll need a startup mentality with enterprise awareness. That means you can manage competing priorities, that you’re ready to pivot or adjust plans quickly, and that you understand the role you and your team play in major organizations’ tech strategies. * Influencing priorities, for both the team and the client. You understand both the business problem and the technical solution, and you’re able to advocate for excellence and effect change when necessary. * Finesse. As consultants, we navigate within our client’s organizations to influence big decision makers and win trust. In this job, you’ll be using your people skills as much as your coding skills. And here’s some of the perks of being part of a unique organization like ThoughtWorks. - * A real commitment to “changing the face of IT” - our way of thinking about diversity and inclusion. Over the past ten years, we’ve implemented a lot of initiatives to make ThoughtWorks a place that reflects the world around us, and to make this a welcoming home to technologists of all stripes. We’re not perfect, but we’re actively working towards true gender balance for our business and our industry, and you’ll see that diversity reflected on our project teams and in offices. * Continuous learning. You’ll be constantly exposed to new languages, frameworks and ideas from your peers and as you work on different projects - challenging you to stay at the top of your game. * No pigeon-holing: at ThoughtWorks, there’s no applying to new roles. With time, you’ll build trust and credibility and move easily into new roles if you’re inclined, like trying out life in a QA or BA’s shoes. * Miles on miles. As consultants, we travel to the client sites every week. At first, you’ll likely travel domestically, but with time, you’ll find opportunities to travel around the world (and rack up some major points along the way.) * Support to grow as a technologist outside of your role at ThoughtWorks. This is why ThoughtWorkers have written over 100 books and can be found speaking at (and, ahem, keynoting) tech conferences all over the world. We love to learn and share knowledge, and you’ll find a community of passionate technologists eager to back your endeavors, whatever they may be. You’ll also receive financial support to attend conferences every year. * An organizational commitment to social responsibility. ThoughtWorkers challenge each other to be just a little more thoughtful about the world around us, and we believe in using our profits for good. All around the world, you’ll find ThoughtWorks supporting great causes and organizations in both official and unofficial capacities. A few important things to know: - * Travel is required. Projects are almost exclusively on customer site, so ThoughtWorkers need to be flexible and up for extensive travel. Most of our consultants travel every week and fly home for weekends. We do our best to take people’s personal situations into account, but we know it’s not for everyone. * Residing near one of our North America offices in Chicago, Dallas, New York, Atlanta or San Francisco is preferable although not necessary. Not quite ready to apply? Or maybe this isn’t the right role for you? This also includes individuals who are perceived to have any of the aforementioned attributes. ThoughtWorks will adhere to all federal, state, and municipal laws and regulations governing employment. #LI-NA

ThoughtWorks is a global software consultancy, made up of around 4,500 passionate technologists across 15 countries. We specialize in strategy, portfolio management and product design, combined with digital engineering excellence. As software consultants, our teams work on a huge variety of projects. You could be helping to influence the digital strategy of a retail giant, building a new mobile application for a bank or redesigning platforms using event sourcing and intelligent data pipelines. You’ll use the latest Lean and Agile thinking, solve mission-critical problems and challenge yourself everyday. Examples of what you’ll be doing: * Using continuous delivery practices to improve software delivery speed * Working in collaborative, product-focused teams to build innovative customer experiences * Creating large scale distributed systems out of microservices * Applying the latest technology thinking from our tech radar ( https://www.thoughtworks.com/radar ) to client problems (with a healthy amount of skepticism) * Helping our clients become data-driven businesses by making real-time data available and using machine learning for competitive advantage * Utilizing DevOps tools and practices to build and deploy software in the most efficient ways What we’re looking for: * Ability to write high-quality, well-tested code. We don’t limit ourselves to one language; experience in any of Java, Scala, C#, Javascript, Ruby or Python is preferred * Experience working with Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches such as Continuous Integration, TDD, Infrastructure as Code, etc. * Knowledge and appreciation of cloud technology such as AWS, Docker or Kubernetes is a plus * A passion for automation; you don’t like doing the same thing twice * We value diversity ( https://www.thoughtworks.com/news/2016-top-companies-for-women-technologists ); we support traditional and nontraditional career paths An Important Note: Projects are almost exclusively on customer site, so ThoughtWorkers should be flexible and open to extensive travel. Desired: Microsoft WordAdministrative ExperienceiWorkBecause you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Where and Why

Twilio is growing rapidly and seeking an Administrative Assistant to support the Senior Director of Product Management as well as the Messaging Organization. This role requires superior organizational skills, keen attention to detail, the ability to meet deadlines, and juggle multiple high priority requests, all while interfacing professionally with people inside and outside the company.

Who?

Twilio is looking for an administrative assistant with a demonstrated track record of executing on their executive's priorities. We seek someone who has:


1 to 3 years of administrative support experience.
Demonstrated integrity while handling confidential information. Understands the need to handle sensitive information with absolute discretion.
Passion and energy level to support the pace of a rapidly growing business.
High attention to detail and consistent follow up.
Flexibility to be available beyond normal office hours if needed.
Mac and Google Docs proficiency preferred, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Google Docs and Sheets skills. Apple Keynote experience a plus.
Experience scheduling in Google Calendar.
Interest and ability to learn about Twilio's business and customers.
Ability to learn new systems
Strong verbal, written, customer service and excellent organizational skills a must.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.
Positive attitude and ability to be flexible.

What?

As an administrative assistant, you will:

Schedule and coordinate logistics for meetings, conferences, and special events (onsite & offsite), including weekly Dept meetings.
Organize visits for external guests of the Director and or Messaging Team. Act as the face of the company and ensure guests are treated with the utmost hospitality.
Organize Quarterly offsites, happy hours and team building events for the Messaging team and brainstorm new initiatives to improve upon employee moral.
Manage the organization of Box and Google Docs used to house internal documentation.
Partner with with the Executive Assistants in R&D on cross-functional projects, including Monthly and Yearly Business Units All-Hands.
Full-service visitor management, including anticipating all needs and last-minute scheduling changes.
Work closely with members of our Executive Business Partners team.
Prepare timely and accurate expense reports.
Handle special projects as required or requested.

Why?

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio

Where?

This position will be located in our beautiful office at 375 Beale Street in San Francisco. You will enjoy our incredible perks: catered meals, snacks, game room, ergonomic desks, massages, Wednesday Night dinners, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate ourvalues ( http://www.twilio.com/values ), who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

About us:
More than 2 million developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, and video by virtualizing the world's telecommunications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers. Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 1,000 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in Bogotá, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Singapore and Tallinn.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Software Developer 4 QA Test Engineer-18001013

Preferred Qualifications
We offer unique opportunities for smart, hands-on engineers with the expertise and passion to solve difficult problems in distributed highly available services and virtualized infrastructure. At every level, our engineers have a significant technical and business impact designing and building innovative new systems to power our customer’s business critical applications.
This position is for a Principal Member of Technical Staff (QA) in high availability testing of Cloud Infrastructure, Oracle Cloud at Customer (OCC), Networking, Storage, Compute and public cloud infrastructure components including RCSM, TAS, PSM.

Requires good understanding of QA processes including test specifications, test plans and automation. Expected to be able to interact independently with development teams and cover testing of new product features. You will ensure that Cloud services meet the quality requirements for high availability functionality. You will need to get a good understanding of the inner workings of new products and components in order to better test them. You will be responsible for automating the testing of these features. In addition, you will be responsible for load and performance testing where needed to properly ensure high availability of the service.

Required Skills
4+ years of experience with distributed, highly-scalable, multi-node environments
Ability to code in Java and/or Python
Comfortable with standard automation frameworks
Familiarity with Cloud Computing
Understanding of virtualization technologies and hypervisors
Understanding of networking and storage technologies
QA automation experience and leadership skills
Ability to translate high level requirements into detailed specifications
Good Communication skills
Highly organized and creative
BS/MS in Computer Science

Additional requirements
Familiarity with OCI-C, Oracle DB, Weblogic is a plus

Detailed Description and Job Requirements
Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc.

As a member of the software engineering division, you will take an active role in the definition and evolution of standard practices and procedures. You will be responsible for defining and developing software for tasks associated with the developing, designing and debugging of software applications or operating systems.

Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience.

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Desired: .NetActive DirectoryC#RESTAzureThe OSIsoft Cloud Services team is looking for software developers interested in working on OSIsoft’s Software as a Service (SaaS) offerings. This is your opportunity to join an exciting, new development effort that will be fundamental to the future of OSIsoft.

Responsibilities:
As part of this team, you will participate in the definition, design, implementation, test, deployment and management of our highly scalable SaaS offerings.
You will make use of Microsoft Azure components such as Service Fabric, Windows Azure Active Directory , Azure Storage, Event Hubs , and other relevant frameworks and technologies like C#, REST, ASP.NET
You will help with all aspects of the development of OSIsoft Cloud Services, including build control & deployment, testing, operations, and content management

Requirements:
Bachelor of Science degree or higher in Computer Science or STEM discipline.
5+ years working knowledge exp. in C# and ASP.NET a must
3+ years of software product or application development.
Ability to work with minimum supervision, work with Product Management to refine incomplete specifications and negotiate features
Ability to clearly communicate complex technology verbally and written.

About OSIsoft

OSIsoft is a global leader in operational intelligence. We deliver an open enterprise infrastructure, the PI System™, to connect sensor-based data, systems and people. OSIsoft has installations in 127 countries and is widely used across manufacturing, energy, utilities, pharmaceuticals, life sciences, data centers, facilities and the process industries, as well as the public sector and the federal government. OSIsoft is headquartered in San Leandro, California, U.S.A, with offices around the world.

At OSIsoft, we provide the industry standard in enterprise infrastructure for management of time series data through the OSIsoft PI System™. Our customers rely upon the PI System™ to safeguard data and deliver enterprise-wide visibility into operational, manufacturing and business information. The PI System™ enables users to manage assets, mitigate risks, comply with regulations, improve processes, drive innovation, make business decisions in real time, and to identify competitive business and market opportunities. We are time series data; if the data has a value at a given time, we collect it, store it, and show it to our customers whenever they need it! We let engineers and managers see exactly what’s going on in their processes in real time – useful, right?

The Role
We are looking for a Staff Software Development Engineer to join our team to create state-of-the-art commercial and consumer application solutions to understand and manage risks, from earthquakes, hurricanes, and floods, to terrorism and infectious disease. The products that you create will delight and empower customers with making informed decisions on Global impact.
 Your job will be to work with a team of engineers, UX/UI designers, product managers, technical project leaders and other Senior stakeholders to innovate and develop applications for RMS customers. Your solutions will leverage the latest advancements in databases, grid-computing, hardware-based acceleration techniques, and visualization optimization. Your implementations will utilize RESTful Web Services, 100+ TB of data warehousing/OLAP solutions, large-scale distributed data processing technology and GPU-based computing in a SaaS environment.
Your success means the high-quality of deliverables, strong engineering practices, fast time to market and increased customer satisfaction. If you’re ready to make a difference to the company and its customers, if you want huge challenges to tackle, we would love to talk to you.
 We are looking for experienced, passionate, hard-working and creative Staff Software Development Engineer who has experience building innovative Web applications using modern Reactive web frameworks. You will have an enormous opportunity to make a large impact on the design, architecture, and implementation of cutting-edge products used by Global customers every day.
 In this role, you will:
Engage with an experienced, cross-disciplinary staff to conceive, design and implement innovative enterprise and consumer products
Analyze requirements, evaluate risks, architect solutions that delight customers despite technical challenges
Prepare technical requirements and software design specifications
Instill best practices for software development and documentation, assure designs meet requirements, and deliver exceptional-quality work on tight schedules
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field
5+ years of experience architecting and developing commercial Web-based software solutions
Knowledge of Web technologies, UI (including .Net UI), Application Design Patterns and the latest Web development tools
High coding-proficiency with the current Web standards and JavaScript frameworks, including all of the following: React, Object Oriented JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, JQuery, JSON, AJAX
Strong engineering principles, familiarity with all stages of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Expertise in Agile methodologies (SCRUM, Kanban, etc.)
Experience integrating software solutions with cloud-powered back-end
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Experience working with geographically distributed teams
Ability to work closely with a senior, robust team, while being a strong individual contributor
A proven ability to deliver high-quality work on tight schedules
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Distributed Computing, ASP.NET MVC3, SVG and HTML5 Canvas
Experience authoring custom JQuery widgets, templates, animation
Experience with Rich Internet Applications (RIA), App Analytics tools, App DevOps
Experience with C#
Experience with Test-Driven Development (TDD)

Come be part of the community of talented, forward-thinking engineers who develop Software that connects Twitter services to the world.
Who We Are:
Twitter responds to hundreds of billions of requests per day, and the Traffic team services support every one of those requests. Our work impacts Twitter worldwide. We build software and services that are fundamental to Twitter’s strategies around growth and revenue. New and exciting efforts are underway that will radically improve latencies and reliability worldwide.

As a software developer on our team, you will work with highly talented engineers on one of the world's highest throughput platforms. You will participate in all of our initiatives, having ample opportunities to both learn and teach. You will be expected to lead some efforts while offering support for others. We collaborate to bring out the best in each other. You will make critical decisions, write designs and code that
Improves latency as perceived by our customers
Upgrades our security
Enhances the reliability of Twitter services
The services you create and operate will play a key role in Twitter user satisfaction and growth. Millions of existing customers will immediately benefit from this work, and many more new customers worldwide will follow. Inside Twitter, your work will empower dozens of engineering teams, and hundreds of co-workers. Externally, you will empower people to connect and communicate.

Our mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
As a Technical Product Manager at Indeed, you will take ownership of one or more products that require technical expertise to manage effectively (e.g., a service, API, library or platform product). That means you, not the VP of Product or the CEO, will define the future of your product and what your team should work on. You will be empowered to set ambitious goals for your product and team. Your goals will not be easy to achieve; they should inspire and motivate the team to think big. You will not be compensated based on whether you deliver product features, but whether you have delivered significant business impact.

You will constantly create hypotheses for improving your product, test them, and learn from the results (see: [1] http://go.indeed.com/data-driven). Our product development philosophy is similar to the Lean Startup philosophy. You will create MVPs, prototypes, incremental rollouts and simple tests to validate ideas and iterate rapidly.

You will sit with your development team and work closely with them on a daily basis. You will define requirements, measure KPIs, track experiments and frequently ship releases. You will do data analysis, whether it’s running queries in MySQL, searching through logs, or using the plethora of in-house tools specially built for the colossal amount of data Indeed gathers (see: [2] http://go.indeed.com/indeed-imhotep).

You will enjoy a casual work environment, flexible hours, and great compensation and benefits. You will wear many hats and constantly learn new things on the job. You will be surrounded by smart, dedicated, nice people. You will be proud of the company’s mission and your product’s impact.

On your first day, we will give you a t-shirt that says, "I help people get jobs." Soon after, you will be wearing your shirt at the grocery store and someone will come up and say, "I love Indeed! I found my job on Indeed. Thank you!" You will smile for the rest of the day. This will happen a lot.

About you:
You're someone who wants to see the impact of your work making a difference every day. Your friends describe you as thorough, analytical and detail-oriented. You are someone with high standards who leads by example, and who will take pride in Indeed like we do.

You’ve got a technical background, and are comfortable slinging some code to solve a problem. You understand how software development teams work, and how engineers think. Most of all, you love solving hard technical challenges to make a difference in the lives of other people, whether they be job seekers, employers or your fellow Indeedians.

The Details

There are dozens of teams and challenges that we work on in the SF office. Current teams with openings for Technical Product Managers in SF include:

Data Science Platform - own the toolkit that is used by Data Scientists at Indeed to quickly develop, train, deploy and test the machine learning models that make Indeed so effective.
Experimentation Platform - own our internal products that support A/B testing at Indeed. This is a key strategic role that requires significant expertise in multivariate, stats-based testing platforms.

We will work with you to find the area that fits your skills and passions.

Requirements


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Electrical Engineering or a closely related field, or equivalent experience.
4+ years of consumer or enterprise internet software product management experience.
Ability to drive, contribute to, and communicate solutions to technical product challenges.
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.
Ability to write code for automation, data analysis, or prototyping product features
Technical understanding of large distributed systems
Outstanding data analysis skills.
Proven leadership skills.
Ability to make data-driven business decisions.

Our mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
As a Product Manager at Indeed, you will collaborate with engineers, data scientists and other relevant functions to help Indeed better measure and deliver value to job seekers and employers. You will be part of a team with an ambitious vision to help people get jobs in new ways. This is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about how data can help build positive experiences and solve hard problems impacting millions of people.

You will be responsible for setting big goals that inspire and motivate the team while leading by example. You, not the CEO or the VP of Product, will define success and the process for achieving it.

Product development at Indeed is an iterative process. We challenge ourselves every single day to look for insights in our data, generate insightful hypotheses about our users and their needs, and run simple tests to check our hypotheses and learn about what to do next. We are fans of minimum viable process and operate using lean startup and agile principles to guide us. We would prefer to spend time simplifying a feature to get it out the door this week than building flashy powerpoint decks for all hands meetings.

About you:
We're not looking for someone who meets a set of requirements exactly. We're more interested in what unique insights you’ll bring to our team in a few key areas.


You have 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally on teams building platforms or data science infrastructure. We build products based on data, hypotheses, and MVPs, not on our opinions or our seniority. We want you to contribute in the same way.
You have experience formulating hypotheses, then designing, running, and analyzing A/B tests to validate them. You have a practical understanding of good experimental design and statistical concepts related to hypothesis testing.
You are comfortable using programming tools to explore data when necessary because you ask questions that can't always be answered using analytics dashboards. We use lots of Python and relational database concepts here, but the specific tools are less important than your ability to extract insights from challenging data.
You have expertise in at least a few machine learning or data mining arenas, and familiarity with many others. You don’t need to implement models from scratch or have formulas memorized, but you should be able to clearly explain concepts like precision and recall or cross validation to non-experts.
You have strong interpersonal skills. Data is how we make decisions here, but we believe that collaboration, teamwork, and communication are critical to that process. Evangelizing our platform across multiple teams at Indeed, gathering requirements and prioritizing customer needs will be a strong component of your success.

The Who, What, Where and Why

This is a Product Management internship for the Summer of 2019. You will be working in a rapidly evolving and fast-paced environment, with a team that is designing the future of cloud communications by empowering businesses across the globe with a set of simple, yet powerful real-time communications APIs.

Who?

Twilio is looking for MBA interns who are capable of breaking down and solving complex problems, and who have a strong will to get things done. The primary role of a Product Manager manager at Twilio is to build products on behalf of customers. A PM is the business owner of the product.

You should have some or all of the following:

Must be a first-year student in a two year Master of Business Administration (MBA) program.
Able to complete a 10-12 week internship beginning in May or June 2018.
3+ years of work experience prior to your MBA.
Superior communication and analytical skills, including a strong ability to identify and solve ambiguous problems and work well with cross-functional teams.
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
Excitement for platform products and passion for empowering others.
A hungry entrepreneurial and "can do" spirit and insatiable will to get stuff done.

What?

This is a hands-on internship responsible for an important product area within the Identity, Serverless or Voice product lines. During your internship, you will:


Partner with engineering and work cross-functionally with all areas of the company including: sales, marketing, support, finance, and operations to identify product opportunities and take them to market.
Be responsible for developing a product growth strategy including a comprehensive analysis of customers, competitive landscape, product opportunities, and technical challenges.
Embed with the day-to-day activities of the team and responsible for taking features from concept to market working closely with engineering and customers.

Teams Hiring:
Identity

The Identity team's mission is to ensure Twilio fits into the workflows of our customers by providing the ability to model complex company structures and granular permissions on our platform. We focus on building features that are easy to get started with and scale to the complex needs of our largest customers. The Identity team is a key part of how customers experience with Twilio, from the UI to configure projects down to the high traffic and mission-critical Identity services.

Wireless:
Wireless team builds products enabling the Internet of Things (IoT) for Twilio's customers. We are a standalone business unit within Twilio, meaning you can work on everything from API design, scalability and big data to collaborating with customers on new IoT offerings. We are looking for someone that want to make an impact on one of Twilio's fastest-growing products, and a dent in the universe.

Serverless team is on a mission to remove the infrastructure barriers for customers building, operating, and scaling communication applications securely and reliably. We own and operate Studio, Twilio's drag and drop visual editor, Functions, our cloud compute layer specifically for communications apps, and a number of other exciting products

Why?

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications.

Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. Come join us.

Where?

This position will be located in our beautiful office at 375 Beale Street in San Francisco. You will enjoy our incredible perks: catered meals, snacks, game room, ergonomic desks, massages, Wednesday Night dinners, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our values ( http://www.twilio.com/values ), who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

About us:
More than 2 million developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, and video by virtualizing the world's telecommunications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers. Founded in 2008, Twilio has over 1,000 employees, with headquarters in San Francisco and other offices in Bogotá, Dublin, Hong Kong, London, Madrid, Mountain View, Munich, New York City, Singapore and Tallinn.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

We’re changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we’re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it’s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.

For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.

And that’s just what we’re doing today. We’re thinking about the future, too. With teams working on new modalities, self-driving cars and even urban air transportation, we’re in for the long haul. We’re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.
About the Role

As an Associate Product Manager, you will join three teams over the course of 18 months (three six-month rotations) across all of Uber, including but not limited to Rider, Driver, Eats, Bikes, Self-Driving Vehicles, Freight, Aviation, and Platforms. The role demands great technical depth, principled thinking, well-honed product judgment, bold innovation, a high design bar, and a mentality of starting with our users and working backwards.
What You’ll Do
Distill vision and strategy for all members of the cross-functional team to set qualitative objectives and quantitative goals
Challenge all members of cross-functional teams (engineering, design, data science, operations, etc.) to think boldly and creatively and funnel that energy into concrete products and execution plans
Drive innovation, definition, deliverables planning (roadmap), and the design of entirely new Uber products and product features to deliver against team and company goals
Collect data to inform product direction, whether in the form of competitive intel, customer behavior, or other business metrics
Monitor and measure launched products to feed learnings back into the product development process
Clearly communicate product plans, benefits and results to a spectrum of audiences, including internal stakeholders, all Uber employees, and riders/driver-partners

What You’ll Need
Current student graduating in 2019 or a recent graduate within 1 year of graduation
A bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical background
Design sensibility and customer obsession
Strong data-driven prioritization skills
Strong communication and partnership skills
A true passion for Uber's mission, our products, and the company's hybrid technology/operations nature
Available for employment in August 2019

Bonus Points If
Product management or entrepreneurial experience

Conducts or oversees business-specific projects by applying deep expertise in subject area; promoting adherence to all procedures and policies; developing work plans to meet business priorities and deadlines; determining and carrying out processes and methodologies; coordinating and delegating resources to accomplish organizational goals; partnering internally and externally to make effective business decisions; solving complex problems; escalating issues or risks, as appropriate; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; evaluating recommendations made; and influencing the completion of project tasks by others.
Practices self-leadership and promotes learning in others by building relationships with cross-functional stakeholders; communicating information and providing advice to drive projects forward; influencing team members within assigned unit; listening and responding to, seeking, and addressing performance feedback; adapting to competing demands and new responsibilities; providing feedback to others, including upward feedback to leadership and mentoring junior team members; creating and executing plans to capitalize on strengths and improve opportunity areas; and adapting to and learning from change, difficulties, and feedback.

Recommends and advocates for regional and national process improvements which align with sustainable best practices, and the strategic and tactical goals of the business.

Our mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
As a Technical Product Manager at Indeed, you will take ownership of one or more products that require technical expertise to manage effectively (e.g., a service, API, library or platform product). That means you, not the VP of Product or the CEO, will define the future of your product and what your team should work on. You will be empowered to set ambitious goals for your product and team. Your goals will not be easy to achieve; they should inspire and motivate the team to think big. You will not be compensated based on whether you deliver product features, but whether you have delivered significant business impact.

You will constantly create hypotheses for improving your product, test them, and learn from the results (see: [1] http://go.indeed.com/data-driven). Our product development philosophy is similar to the Lean Startup philosophy. You will create MVPs, prototypes, incremental rollouts and simple tests to validate ideas and iterate rapidly.

You will sit with your development team and work closely with them on a daily basis. You will define requirements, measure KPIs, track experiments and frequently ship releases. You will do data analysis, whether it’s running queries in MySQL, searching through logs, or using the plethora of in-house tools specially built for the colossal amount of data Indeed gathers (see: [2] http://go.indeed.com/indeed-imhotep).

You will enjoy a casual work environment, flexible hours, and great compensation and benefits. You will wear many hats and constantly learn new things on the job. You will be surrounded by smart, dedicated, nice people. You will be proud of the company’s mission and your product’s impact.

On your first day, we will give you a t-shirt that says, "I help people get jobs." Soon after, you will be wearing your shirt at the grocery store and someone will come up and say, "I love Indeed! I found my job on Indeed. Thank you!" You will smile for the rest of the day. This will happen a lot.

About you:
You're someone who wants to see the impact of your work making a difference every day. Your friends describe you as thorough, analytical and detail-oriented. You are someone with high standards who leads by example, and who will take pride in Indeed like we do.

You’ve got a technical background, and are comfortable slinging some code to solve a problem. You understand how software development teams work, and how engineers think. Most of all, you love solving hard technical challenges to make a difference in the lives of other people, whether they be job seekers, employers or your fellow Indeedians.

The Details

There are dozens of teams and challenges that we work on in the SF office. Current teams with openings for Technical Product Managers in SF include:

Data Science Platform - own the toolkit that is used by Data Scientists at Indeed to quickly develop, train, deploy and test the machine learning models that make Indeed so effective.
Experimentation Platform - own our internal products that support A/B testing at Indeed. This is a key strategic role that requires significant expertise in multivariate, stats-based testing platforms.

We will work with you to find the area that fits your skills and passions.

Requirements


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Electrical Engineering or a closely related field, or equivalent experience.
4+ years of consumer or enterprise internet software product management experience.
Ability to drive, contribute to, and communicate solutions to technical product challenges.
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.
Ability to write code for automation, data analysis, or prototyping product features
Technical understanding of large distributed systems
Outstanding data analysis skills.
Proven leadership skills.
Ability to make data-driven business decisions.

Webgility delivers SaaS products that help thousands of small to medium-sized multi-channel businesses automate their back-office jobs like accounting, shipping, inventory management, tax compliance and more. We are looking for a Product Manager to join the team. We’re experiencing incredible growth, and we need a strong PM to help us deliver features that are mission critical to our customer's success and our business. You'll be reporting to the CEO and have an opportunity to make a massive impact in the eCommerce space. Your technical skills and product management abilities will be put to test and you'll work with a cross-functional team of highly talented yet laid back people.

Job Description:
You will work closely with customers, product, and engineering team to design, develop and launch high impact features for our SaaS products delivered on Cloud, Mobile and PC. Our products deliver complex data integration, automation, and analytics capabilities. You'll be responsible for taking features from idea to adoption. You will understand customer needs and translate them into detailed technical specifications including user stories, systems design, test cases, etc. We have a distributed engineering and quality team with most of them at our offshore development center in India. You'll work closely with the team to develop features, run user-testing for releases and collaborate with customers to ensure there is strong adoption after launch. You'll have a strong understanding of modern APIs, distributed systems and architectures, ecommerce platforms and back office systems.

In this role, you’ve got to have experience with e-Commerce, Retail, Accounting and Tax for small businesses, or a clear path to achieving expertise rapidly. Our products offer depth of automation and analytics, integrating with over 100 apps and software systems. Having a strong technical mindset and understanding of APIs and systems architecture is a must. We have a distributed engineering and product team so you must be adept at working with highly technical remote teams in a flexible environment with strong communication skills. You’ll be juggling multiple features and priorities. Being a good project manager will come in handy. You need to be a constant learner, and someone who can structure product initiatives like Beta tests and segmented roll-outs to maximize learning in order to iterate on the product. You’ll also plan and execute training for support, sales and marketing for the features you deliver.

Job Requirements:
At least 2 years experience in a product or technical product role.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering required, advanced degree desirable
Strong understanding of development technologies including OOP, C#/Microsoft.NET, SQL Server, Javascript
Proven experience in building desktop and web applications and deploying high availability solutions on cloud based platforms (AWS, Azure, Google)
Proven expertise in designing and delivering complex integration and automation solutions
Working knowledge of client/server, desktop, mobile, database, and development tools
Experienced in agile development methodologies and can be a champion and coach for driving best practices
Expertise in e-commerce applications: shopping carts, marketplaces, inventory systems, shipping, taxes, etc.
Technical expertise. You're not expected to write code but you need to speak engineering.
Expertise and a proven track record successfully building accounting/financial business applications is highly desired
Strong written, verbal and presentation skills

You will have the opportunity to lead varied product features covering mobile, web, analytics, and machine learning. For each feature, you will be responsible for the full life cycle from feature conception and design to engineering execution to launch. Slack is looking to add an experienced Product Manager to our fast growing data team. In this role, you’ll not only develop our data tools and systems but you’ll also own the planning and execution of our internal data tools and data platform. The ideal person possesses a depth of functional experience in product management and an expertise in analytical frameworks. Coupled with this experience, you have a proven record of success in quickly growing companies and you're ready to be part of a collaborative product team.

Slack is a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—if this sounds like a good fit for you, send us a nice hello.

What you will be doing

You will drive the strategy and roadmap for data/analytics tools and systems.
You will define requirements across product, analytics, engineering, and native apps to craft a suite of data tools and projects—including our internal event logging system, data processing engines, experimentation framework, and data visualization and dashboard tools.
You will uncover the needs of internal customer groups—including Slack's executive team, product teams, and business and operations teams—and couple them with intuitive and actionable data solutions.
You will emphasize the value of data/analytics and help drive a data-informed culture. You will have the ability to tell a compelling story with this data because numbers are only as good as the way in which they are presented.
What you should have

5+ years of industry experience
2+ years of product management experience
Experience partnering with cross-functional teams like engineering and analytics to define, build, and maintain products which are essential to growth, engagement, and retention
Experience working with engineering teams to design and build products in a fast-paced environment
Familiarity with core statistical concepts, including hypothesis testing, the design of experiments, and confidence intervals
Familiarity with backend data processing engines like Apache Hive and Apache Spark, interactive SQL query engines like Presto and Impala, and systems for analyzing events in near-real time like Druid and Logstash

Primer is an Artificial Intelligence company that organizes and analyzes text-based data sources and generates analyst-grade natural language summaries for a variety of industries. Product development at Primer moves rapidly between research, design, engineering, and testing. Product managers manage innovation within the constraints of delivery deadlines and evolving customer needs. They jump between strategic planning, problem-solving facilitation, ideation sessions, deep-dives into scientific literature, and user testing.
