Job Details
Enterprises, start-ups, teams, developers and businesses of all sizes use Heroku to deploy, manage, and scale applications. The Heroku “Elements” marketplace is one of the key differentiators and the reason customers choose Heroku as their app development platform. Our ecosystem of fully managed cloud-based services work in concert to provide developers with the components they need to create revolutionary apps, and successful businesses.


At Heroku, we understand and recognize the importance of the broad cloud services ecosystem. That's part of why the Heroku Elements marketplace is one of the highest-rated add-on marketplaces across cloud platforms and among the most profitable for our add-on partners.

About The Heroku Ecosystem Team
The Heroku Ecosystem team is a startup and, by definition, small and agile, so the ability to lead change and deal with ambiguity is a must. We are looking for highly motivated leaders who are interested in taking ownership of their area and running it end-to-end.
The Role Details
You will own partner business operations and be a key driver of our efforts to expand and land new categories of fully managed cloud services sold through our ever growing partner ecosystem. You will innovate processes to deliver the best partner experience to drive further growth to Heroku's ecosystem and enable each of our partners to scale out their business utilizing the tools and APIs we build.


We need strong leaders who are self-starters, execution-focused and passionate about providing a friction-free experience for our partners. This is an entry-level product manager role, the ideal role for a person in consulting, operations or a project/program manager looking to transition to product management. This role is currently 75% business operations and 25% product strategy. The successful candidate will execute our current business processes with the goal of streamlining and creating new features to support the growth of our partner programs. As the Product Manager of Ecosystem Programs, you'll:

Build, manage, and scale programs for Heroku third-party service integrations offered by 150+ partners
Understand business needs / vision and align delivery in partnership with Marketing, Sales, Biz Ops, Engineering and Partners
Define business metrics, measure marketplace revenue growth and performance, and identify trends to reduce platform abuse while growing usage of partner services
Surface actionable insights and recommendations for improving effectiveness of operating processes and initiatives by leveraging data from SQL queries and BI tools e.g. Looker
Drive cross-functional alignment on product and go-to-market program strategies, develop and execute plans, and monitor progress using a data-driven approach
Identify marketplace gaps and prioritize partnerships to expand service integrations and deliver more revenue-generating services on Heroku platform
Design, manage, and ship new data product features in Salesforce CRM to capture relevant business information that are accessible to Marketing, Sales, Support, and Engineering teams.
Create polished decks / documentation to portray the status of the program
Plan and organize partner communications including newsletters, social events, and meetups including quarterly partner engagement events globally

Key Competencies & Responsibilities
Have experience with project/portfolio management; concurrently managing multiple deliverables for a range of stakeholders on tight deadlines.
Experience in managing partner and/or alliance relationships, preferably in cloud environments.
Passion for customer and partner business scenarios translating to design impact on the platform
Outstanding interpersonal awareness and communication skills
Strong analytical capabilities. You excel at and enjoy building insights from data points using SQL queries and industry standard tools.
2+ years of product management or business operations experience with demonstrated ability to discover opportunities, and improve process and products.
Strong customer, partner and stakeholder empathy. You'll be the interface between marketing, sales finance, engineering, support and ops. The ability to channel and prioritize multiple viewpoints is key.
Occasional travel (10 - 20%) for industry and partner events with a focus on SF (Bay Area) engagements

Job Description Summary:
Strategic Product Management at Xoom, a PayPal Service

Job Description:
We’re looking for a Sr. Product Manager in San Francisco, for Xoom, A PayPal Service.

You’ll work on Xoom’s most strategic new features and develop product roadmaps for our growing global business. In a typical day, you might:
Speak to customers that send money from Houston to Honduras, Munich to Mumbai, Glasgow to Ghana, Vancouver to Vietnam, or Madrid to Morocco
Coordinate with our software architects, product managers and UX team to build multiple features that work together to reach a goal
Meet a law firm in France as you craft a plan to tailor our product to new regulations
Present to executives your product roadmap for instantly verifying customer identities
Host a design sprint focused on reducing fraud losses
Meet with a payment processor, along with colleagues from Braintree, as you plan our funds-in product build in a new market
Present a strategy to executives to get more PayPal users sending to banks and for cash pickup with Xoom

Core job responsibilities:
Build, and thoroughly document strategic product roadmap recommendations
Define product requirements and implementation details, writing clear, detailed and thorough specifications for complex features, functionality and products
Ensure proper communication cadence with local and international leadership
Liaise with engineering, design, product management, and other cross-functional stakeholders to ensure features and technical specifications meet defined business requirements
Define and measure KPIs for success of new products and markets
Identify partnerships and service providers that Xoom can leverage to win in global markets. As needed, engage in contract negotiations and service details

You have:
5+ years' experience working with global products in a top tech or payments company
Built a product from concept to launch
Experience working in an international or multi-cultural product or setting
Management consulting or entrepreneurial experience a plus
Strong analytical skills to determine the right metrics and turn data into insight

Education:
BA/BS in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
MBA a strong plus

About you:

Customer driven – you seek in-depth understanding of customer needs and turn that insight into a compelling vision and strategy for the product.

Passionate problem solver – no problem is too complex, unknown, or ambiguous to tackle. You work with people across the company, coordinating with experts to ensure your solutions create amazing customer experiences and align with goals in marketing, legal, compliance, fraud, and customer service.

Own your results – nothing can stop you from delivering the best for our customers. You’ll evangelize your product vision to Xoom and PayPal executives and convince the rest of the organization of your plans.

Strategic – you understand Xoom’s business and are driven to understand money transfer from 360 degrees. You’re not satisfied until your product plan has considered all the angles.

Think globally. You ensure product solutions work around the world, and you gain customer and market insights across cultures and geographies. You can tailor features and user experiences to our culturally diverse customer segments.

Our mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
As a Product Manager at Indeed, you will collaborate with engineers, data scientists and other relevant functions to help Indeed better measure and deliver value to job seekers and employers. You will be part of a team with an ambitious vision to help people get jobs in new ways. This is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about how data can help build positive experiences and solve hard problems impacting millions of people.

You will be responsible for setting big goals that inspire and motivate the team while leading by example. You, not the CEO or the VP of Product, will define success and the process for achieving it.

Product development at Indeed is an iterative process. We challenge ourselves every single day to look for insights in our data, generate insightful hypotheses about our users and their needs, and run simple tests to check our hypotheses and learn about what to do next. We are fans of minimum viable process and operate using lean startup and agile principles to guide us. We would prefer to spend time simplifying a feature to get it out the door this week than building flashy powerpoint decks for all hands meetings.

About you:
We're not looking for someone who meets a set of requirements exactly. We're more interested in what unique insights you’ll bring to our team in a few key areas.


You have 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally on teams building platforms or data science infrastructure. We build products based on data, hypotheses, and MVPs, not on our opinions or our seniority. We want you to contribute in the same way.
You have experience formulating hypotheses, then designing, running, and analyzing A/B tests to validate them. You have a practical understanding of good experimental design and statistical concepts related to hypothesis testing.
You are comfortable using programming tools to explore data when necessary because you ask questions that can't always be answered using analytics dashboards. We use lots of Python and relational database concepts here, but the specific tools are less important than your ability to extract insights from challenging data.
You have expertise in at least a few machine learning or data mining arenas, and familiarity with many others. You don’t need to implement models from scratch or have formulas memorized, but you should be able to clearly explain concepts like precision and recall or cross validation to non-experts.
You have strong interpersonal skills. Data is how we make decisions here, but we believe that collaboration, teamwork, and communication are critical to that process. Evangelizing our platform across multiple teams at Indeed, gathering requirements and prioritizing customer needs will be a strong component of your success.

Your technical skills and product management abilities will be put to test and you'll work with a cross-functional team of highly talented yet laid back people.

You will work closely with customers, product, and engineering team to design, develop and launch high impact features for our SaaS products delivered on Cloud, Mobile and PC. Our products deliver complex data integration, automation, and analytics capabilities. You'll be responsible for taking features from idea to adoption. You will understand customer needs and translate them into detailed technical specifications including user stories, systems design, test cases, etc. We have a distributed engineering and quality team with most of them at our offshore development center in India. You'll work closely with the team to develop features, run user-testing for releases and collaborate with customers to ensure there is strong adoption after launch. You'll have a strong understanding of modern APIs, distributed systems and architectures, ecommerce platforms and back office systems.

In this role, you’ve got to have experience with e-Commerce, Retail, Accounting and Tax for small businesses, or a clear path to achieving expertise rapidly. Once customers have used Affirm to make a purchase at one of our partner merchants, they return to Affirm’s website or mobile app every month to make payments towards their outstanding installment loans. This regular touchpoint offers a unique opportunity for Affirm to develop a long-lasting relationship with our customers by creating a simple and delightful repayment experience that includes personalized content to further engage our active customers.

As a Product Manager on the User Servicing/Engagement team, you will develop new features and products to improve repayment rates for outstanding loans based on a combination of data analysis, user research, and product intuition, while eschewing traditional heavy-handed debt collection practices. You will also be responsible for developing a user-centric approach for surfacing promotions and other relevant content to our active customers across all of our products and communications channels to create a deeper relationship with our customers.
What you'll do
Develop a compelling product strategy and roadmap for user servicing/engagement based on a combination of target metrics and desired business outcomes
Become intimately familiar with internal repayment and engagement metrics and synthesize that information into KPIs that are tracked on a regular basis and inform the product roadmap
Work closely with User Research, Design, and Engineering counterparts to identify, prioritize, spec, and ship features and experiments that meaningfully improve the customer repayment experience and associated internal business metrics
Coordinate customer engagement efforts across multiple product and business teams to develop a user-centric product framework for surfacing relevant content and offers throughout the repayment experience
Develop new features and functionality for our user communications and user portal platforms to improve the customer repayment experience and support the various cross-functional teams that also depend on these channels
Become an expert on relevant trends, regulations, and industry developments in repayment and consumer finance generally; socialize insights with the broader team; and use that knowledge to influence the Servicing/Engagement product roadmap
What we look for
Passion and drive to change consumer finance for the better
Creative product thinkers who love collaborating across the company with engineering, analytics, legal, finance, marketing, design and sales
Strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for precise articulations of customer problems
Experience managing technical software products from kick-off to post-launch
A get-things-done attitude to make your product and team successful whether that means writing a QA plan or investigating the root cause of a customer support ticket
Being able to turn incomplete, conflicting, or ambiguous inputs into solid action plans
Obsesses over getting the details right but knows how to ship on time
Driven to question assumptions and validate hypotheses
Familiarity with SQL and Excel for product analysis
ABOUT AFFIRM

At Affirm we are using technology to re-imagine and re-build core parts of financial infrastructure to enable friendlier and more transparent financial products and services that improve lives.

We believe the financial industry is fundamentally broken. Not only is the core infrastructure built with technology from the 1970s, but there are a dwindling number of people who say "I trust my bank to look out for me". It doesn’t have to be this way, and it’s our mission to fix this problem.

We are based in San Francisco; founded by Max Levchin (founding CTO of PayPal), Jeff Kaditz (CDO DeNA/ngmoco), and Nathan Gettings (founding CTO of Palantir); and building a team of exceptionally talented people to join us on our mission.

Desired: Data MiningMicrosoft PowerpointMachine LearningPythonOur mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
As a Product Manager at Indeed, you will collaborate with engineers, data scientists and other relevant functions to help Indeed better measure and deliver value to job seekers and employers. You will be part of a team with an ambitious vision to help people get jobs in new ways. This is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about how data can help build positive experiences and solve hard problems impacting millions of people.

You will be responsible for setting big goals that inspire and motivate the team while leading by example. You, not the CEO or the VP of Product, will define success and the process for achieving it.

Product development at Indeed is an iterative process. We challenge ourselves every single day to look for insights in our data, generate insightful hypotheses about our users and their needs, and run simple tests to check our hypotheses and learn about what to do next. We are fans of minimum viable process and operate using lean startup and agile principles to guide us. We would prefer to spend time simplifying a feature to get it out the door this week than building flashy powerpoint decks for all hands meetings.

About you:
We're not looking for someone who meets a set of requirements exactly. We're more interested in what unique insights you’ll bring to our team in a few key areas.


You have 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally on teams building platforms or data science infrastructure. We build products based on data, hypotheses, and MVPs, not on our opinions or our seniority. We want you to contribute in the same way.
You have experience formulating hypotheses, then designing, running, and analyzing A/B tests to validate them. You have a practical understanding of good experimental design and statistical concepts related to hypothesis testing.
You are comfortable using programming tools to explore data when necessary because you ask questions that can't always be answered using analytics dashboards. We use lots of Python and relational database concepts here, but the specific tools are less important than your ability to extract insights from challenging data.
You have expertise in at least a few machine learning or data mining arenas, and familiarity with many others. You don’t need to implement models from scratch or have formulas memorized, but you should be able to clearly explain concepts like precision and recall or cross validation to non-experts.
You have strong interpersonal skills. Data is how we make decisions here, but we believe that collaboration, teamwork, and communication are critical to that process. Evangelizing our platform across multiple teams at Indeed, gathering requirements and prioritizing customer needs will be a strong component of your success.

Desired: MySQLAnalysis SkillsMachine LearningOur mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
As a Technical Product Manager at Indeed, you will take ownership of one or more products that require technical expertise to manage effectively (e.g., a service, API, library or platform product). That means you, not the VP of Product or the CEO, will define the future of your product and what your team should work on. You will be empowered to set ambitious goals for your product and team. Your goals will not be easy to achieve; they should inspire and motivate the team to think big. You will not be compensated based on whether you deliver product features, but whether you have delivered significant business impact.

You will constantly create hypotheses for improving your product, test them, and learn from the results (see: [1] http://go.indeed.com/data-driven). Our product development philosophy is similar to the Lean Startup philosophy. You will create MVPs, prototypes, incremental rollouts and simple tests to validate ideas and iterate rapidly.

You will sit with your development team and work closely with them on a daily basis. You will define requirements, measure KPIs, track experiments and frequently ship releases. You will do data analysis, whether it’s running queries in MySQL, searching through logs, or using the plethora of in-house tools specially built for the colossal amount of data Indeed gathers (see: [2] http://go.indeed.com/indeed-imhotep).

You will enjoy a casual work environment, flexible hours, and great compensation and benefits. You will wear many hats and constantly learn new things on the job. You will be surrounded by smart, dedicated, nice people. You will be proud of the company’s mission and your product’s impact.

On your first day, we will give you a t-shirt that says, "I help people get jobs." Soon after, you will be wearing your shirt at the grocery store and someone will come up and say, "I love Indeed! I found my job on Indeed. Thank you!" You will smile for the rest of the day. This will happen a lot.

About you:
You're someone who wants to see the impact of your work making a difference every day. Your friends describe you as thorough, analytical and detail-oriented. You are someone with high standards who leads by example, and who will take pride in Indeed like we do.

You’ve got a technical background, and are comfortable slinging some code to solve a problem. You understand how software development teams work, and how engineers think. Most of all, you love solving hard technical challenges to make a difference in the lives of other people, whether they be job seekers, employers or your fellow Indeedians.

The Details

There are dozens of teams and challenges that we work on in the SF office. Current teams with openings for Technical Product Managers in SF include:

Data Science Platform - own the toolkit that is used by Data Scientists at Indeed to quickly develop, train, deploy and test the machine learning models that make Indeed so effective.
Experimentation Platform - own our internal products that support A/B testing at Indeed. This is a key strategic role that requires significant expertise in multivariate, stats-based testing platforms.

We will work with you to find the area that fits your skills and passions.

Requirements


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Electrical Engineering or a closely related field, or equivalent experience.
4+ years of consumer or enterprise internet software product management experience.
Ability to drive, contribute to, and communicate solutions to technical product challenges.
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.
Ability to write code for automation, data analysis, or prototyping product features
Technical understanding of large distributed systems
Outstanding data analysis skills.
Proven leadership skills.
Ability to make data-driven business decisions.

Who we are

Where we are
Our headquarters are located in San Francisco’s SOMA district.
Who are you?
You are intellectually curious and have an insatiable desire to solve problems.
You are comfortable speaking in front of groups and leading cross-functional teams.
You have the ability to sweat the details and then flip the switch to zoom out to understand the corporate strategy.
You know how to inspire, motivate and support your teammates in order to deliver impactful solutions to our user groups.
You have a strong “product gut” but stringently use data to bolster your arguments/hypotheses.
You care about your co-workers and are invested in their growth professionally and personally.
What’s the job, really?
Working in a scrum team with dedicated engineers, you’ll be gathering requirements from cross-functional teams, building the core platform for the company and helping us achieve corporate goals

Communicate and coordinate with the other product scrum teams to ensure that the roadmaps are in sync
This role reports to the Product Management Manager

Experience working with cross-functional departments to gather requirements and evangelize projects and prioritization
You feel comfortable acting as a de-facto project manager to ensure your team stays on track
Ability to mentor less experienced product managers to help elevate their game
Ability to take full ownership of a product scrum team and lead the team to achieve success with minimal oversight
Why should you care?

About Us
--------

With over 15 million active users and $90 million in venture funding, Life360 is the world's largest mobile app for families. Today, we are focused on location sharing and safety, but our mission is to become the must-have Family Membership that gives families peace of mind anytime and anywhere.

From personalized location-based alerts that help make daily coordination easier, to advanced sensor tech that can detect if you are in a car crash and automatically send you an ambulance, we are leveraging smartphones to their fullest extent to reinvent how families get through the day.

You will be joining Life360 at a key moment in our history. We doubled active users and more than tripled revenue over the last year. We are scaling our team to accommodate this rapid growth. We currently have 95 full time employees, with offices in San Francisco, Las Vegas, and San Diego.

About the Job
-------------

We are looking for a entrepreneurial-minded product manager who can roll-up their sleeves and help strategize new revenue opportunities through a mix of channels, which may include re-envisioning our membership subscription, partnerships and white-label services. Working from our San Francisco office, you will work across our organization to define a vision and bring to life a subscription service that encompasses the unique needs of our demographic of families. You will be a key player in defining the strategy and managing the product development from concept through launch. This is an amazing opportunity to create an innovative customer experience and help us broaden our reach in supporting and bringing families closer together.

Responsibilities
----------------


Strategize and manage the implementation of new revenue opportunities with an emphasis on building out a membership subscription service to our audience of families
Imagine, explore and investigate, then define a new subscription model across multiple verticals in the home, automotive, and family safety space - including competitive analysis, business case, customer needs, product requirements and go-to-market strategy
Outreach to potential partners, assessing implications of build versus buy and making recommendations to executives and stakeholders
Manage cross-functional teams around your ideas, leading key stakeholders to deliver a world class, one of a kind product and service
Launch and actively manage the product/business line to constantly understand performance, rigorously A/B test, iterate and adjust for product market fit, and stay on the forefront of innovation and user needs
Own the performance of the product, define metrics for success and failure, ensuring that the product achieves its financial objectives.
Provide ongoing product management leadership for the Monetization team Ensure we are delivering a product that has deep user value and solves real pain points families face each day

Qualifications
--------------


3+ years experience in product management or building a subscription business, along with lots of passion, excitement and energy
Strong business and product sense, ability to ask the right questions, find the right data, make decisions and move fast
Strong preference for experience in the subscription/membership space but not required
Able to motivate and focus disparate teams to get things done, while also communicating concepts and plans to executives and stakeholders of all levels
Confidence in making recommendations, balance trade offs -- based on customer need, data insights, and business opportunities
Deep love for delighting customers in new and innovative ways, excited by undefined opportunity
Experience working with consumer-facing mobile apps (iOS and Android).
Strong oral and written communication skills

Desired: GitGoProject ManagementAbout us:
Tendermint is building state-of-the-art consensus and networking protocols to enable internet-scale distributed applications. We’re passionate, self-driven, industry leaders whose mission is to build a better, freer internet. We're also building the Cosmos Network, a decentralized network of independent parallel blockchains, each powered by classical BFT consensus algorithms like Tendermint Core. We believe the technology we're building will have a major impact on human beings around the world. We’re well funded and growing quickly.

How we work:
Our software development teams are broken up into Tendermint, Cosmos SDK, and Voyager. Our teams leverage agile methodologies to move quickly and stay focused. Most of us work out of our offices in Berkeley, Toronto, and Berlin, but some of our employees work remotely. Communication is important to us and we rely heavily on Slack, Zoom, and GitHub to help us stay in sync. Everything we build is open source and available on GitHub.

This is a full time position and is located in either Berlin, Toronto, Berkeley, or San Francisco.
We're looking for someone who has:
At least 5 years of software engineering experience.
At least 2 years of product and/or project management experience.
Significant experience writing Golang.
Experience working in an agile development environment.
The ability to take ownership and see initiatives through.
Worked with and mentored junior engineers.
Exceptional communication skills.
Experience working with distributed teams.
What your primary responsibilities will be:
Participate in discussion forums with users of the Cosmos-SDK to improve usability by incorporating their feedback.
Plan the Cosmos-SDK roadmap and software development cycles, and co-ordinate their execution.
Maintain the Cosmos-SDK software release process, including versioning, changelogs, and dependency updates.
Foster an exceptional open-source culture by responding in a timely, polite, and constructive manner to issues and pull-requests, by using labels and other tools effectively, and by doing regular maintenance.
Help with developer adoption by supporting projects using the SDK.
Host standups, team meetings, 1-on-1s, and retrospectives.
Escalate issues and report updates on behalf of the team when necessary
What we offer:
The opportunity to build the future of the internet.
An exciting role building open source software.
Flexible work schedule.
Travel stipend for conferences and in person collaboration.
At least 4 weeks of paid vacation.
Very competitive salary, including equity.
About our application process:
Qualified candidates can expect to go through a 4 step interview process. The first interview will be a call to assess cultural fit and to make sure our goals are aligned.

If we think there is a good fit, you'll have a call with one of our project managers to learn more about your skills and attitudes toward teamwork. If it's clear that you'd be a good addition to the team, we’ll ask you to complete a technical task for which you will be compensated.

If your technical task displays a high level of quality and care we will set up a final interview with our CEO or CTO.

The process can take up to 3 weeks.

Our mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
As a Product Manager at Indeed, you will collaborate with engineers, data scientists and other relevant functions to help Indeed better measure and deliver value to job seekers and employers. You will be part of a team with an ambitious vision to help people get jobs in new ways. This is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about how data can help build positive experiences and solve hard problems impacting millions of people.

You will be responsible for setting big goals that inspire and motivate the team while leading by example. You, not the CEO or the VP of Product, will define success and the process for achieving it.

Product development at Indeed is an iterative process. We challenge ourselves every single day to look for insights in our data, generate insightful hypotheses about our users and their needs, and run simple tests to check our hypotheses and learn about what to do next. We are fans of minimum viable process and operate using lean startup and agile principles to guide us. We would prefer to spend time simplifying a feature to get it out the door this week than building flashy powerpoint decks for all hands meetings.

About you:
We're not looking for someone who meets a set of requirements exactly. We're more interested in what unique insights you’ll bring to our team in a few key areas.


You have 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally on teams building platforms or data science infrastructure. We build products based on data, hypotheses, and MVPs, not on our opinions or our seniority. We want you to contribute in the same way.
You have experience formulating hypotheses, then designing, running, and analyzing A/B tests to validate them. You have a practical understanding of good experimental design and statistical concepts related to hypothesis testing.
You are comfortable using programming tools to explore data when necessary because you ask questions that can't always be answered using analytics dashboards. We use lots of Python and relational database concepts here, but the specific tools are less important than your ability to extract insights from challenging data.
You have expertise in at least a few machine learning or data mining arenas, and familiarity with many others. You don’t need to implement models from scratch or have formulas memorized, but you should be able to clearly explain concepts like precision and recall or cross validation to non-experts.
You have strong interpersonal skills. Data is how we make decisions here, but we believe that collaboration, teamwork, and communication are critical to that process. Evangelizing our platform across multiple teams at Indeed, gathering requirements and prioritizing customer needs will be a strong component of your success.

Product Management Intern, New Services (San Mateo)

As a partner to leading carrier, retail, and OEM companies, we have grown our white-labeled solutions to a subscriber base in the hundreds of millions. The current set of solutions span everything from the Connected Home/IoT to Identity, and we’re looking for ambitious Product people who deal well with ambiguity and want to re-define how industry approaches problems.

Navigate and prioritize the numerous Product development paths with a framework and corresponding justification.
Work with external third parties (when necessary) to assess partnership and licensing opportunities.
Demonstrate the interpersonal skills to cross-functionally influence at an Executive, managerial level, as well as a front line team level

Product Manager, Experiments(Seeking Former Founder)
San Francisco, California

Scalable Press is focused on revolutionizing the printing industry through technology. Through our family of sites and services, we're a rapidly growing company that’s already used by over 10 million unique visitors per month.

The printing industry consists of thousands of small print shops across the country that are content with serving their local markets and sticking with outdated business practices. In general, our competition is focused on high-margin, low-volume business. Our entire industry is inefficient, slow, and overpriced, and we're here to change it.

This listing is not for a particular role(though we’ve decided to give it a title of Product Manager since the listing requires a title); it’s to find a particular type: founders. We’re running an ambitious startup. That means handling constant chaos, venturing into uncharted territory, and building new things from scratch. Founders are the breed of people who know how to do this. As for what you’ll specifically do? That will depend on whatever your skills are. Maybe you run a conference on real-time customized manufacturing using APIs. Maybe you are in charge of recruiting other executives who know how to execute autonomously. Maybe you’re the one who networks with founders of other companies to help them leverage our tech. Maybe you’re running iterative market tests by leveraging our eng team to building a few MVPs and landing pages and determining which one can get to $1M ARR first. Maybe you do all of these, because you’re a founder.

Our team is on an incredible growth trajectory and we're looking for passionate former founder profile. Currently we’re referring to this role as the Product Manager of Labs(our autonomous, new experimental products group).
In this Product Manager role, you will:
Own the process for Labs, building MVPs using our print API which already supports millions of purchases per year
Launch new products(websites, mobile apps, etc.) and foray into uncharted territories of opportunity
Lead a team and work hand-in-hand with engineers, a growth hacker, and other stakeholders(from other PMs on the engineering team, to Engineers, to Operations, and Marketing)
Quickly build MVPs and landing pages that test market ideas.
Foster a culture of data-driven decision making.
Interact with the key internal business stakeholdersto understand our business needs and prioritize them effectively.
We're looking for someone that's intelligent, hard working, and unreasonably ambitious. You should:
Have experience working as the former founder of a startup or one of the early members
Be excited about the idea of successfully launching a product
Terrific product sense with the ability to think from the customers’ perspective
Have a quantitative, results-oriented thinking style
Want to be a part of an aggressive, growth-minded team
Have some technical experience and/or background. Design or Marketing-focused past founders will be considered, though you must be even stronger on the non-technical aspects
Be able to deliver our(continued) triple digit growth
Have a prodigious work ethic
This is a rare and unique opportunity to build products with high autonomy(perfectly suited for a“founder-type” candidate).

About Us:
Scalable Press is a technology company revolutionizing the printing industry. We believe thatby investing in forward-thinking technology and infrastructure, we can make it easier and faster than ever to order custom printing.

We own and operate five production centers spanning California, Texas, Indiana, and Pennsylvania. Our custom engineered systems, paired with our nationwide presence, allows us to push prices down to unprecedented lows, provide reliable quality, and offer fast turnaround times.

Key facts:
Scalable Press has never raised funding - our companyis bootstrapped and profitable.
We have over 300 employees.
Our facilities include over 200,000 square feet of production space.
We’ve averaged triple-digit growth over the past 3 years.
We print and ship millions of products each year.

Our Company
Insikt is a rapidly growing technology company that connects borrowers seeking loans with investors seeking better, stable returns. Our mission is to bring trust and transparency back to the world of lending and securitization while also helping underserved families and small businesses find responsible credit options. We are accomplishing this mission by enabling:

1. Lending: Our proprietary white-label lending platform (Lendify) allows any retail store, online brand, or distribution partner to make loans or provide purchase financing to its customers, in its own brand name, without any prior credit expertise and with minimal upfront investment.
2. Investing: Our proprietary investing platform allows accredited investors to buy into a variety of investment instruments backed by distinct loan portfolios underwritten in-house. Each investor has online access to all the same data as our Risk and Analytics teams, ensuring transparency into all investment instruments.

We have brought together the best and brightest from top-tier technology companies, leading financial service providers, and world-class investment firms. We are funded by some of the best investors and entrepreneurs in the world, including First Mark Capital, Revolution Ventures, Capital One, Continental Investors and Serengeti Asset Management.

Our Values
We are a tight-knit team of highly talented and motivated people from a diverse set of backgrounds and industries all tenaciously driven by our mission. We value creativity, courage, and collaboration and we believe in letting the best and most innovative ideas rise to the top. We are looking for the absolute best people who want work hard, play hard, and build a socially-minded, profitable, and enduring business in the process.

The Job
Insikt is looking for a Product Manager to move new feature development forward from ideation through implementation. Our product team integrates thought across user research, analytics, and strategic business vision to drive direction and simplicity into our technology offerings. You will be responsible for:

Sourcing and conducting user research to uncover customer need
Working with business, engineering, and design to come up with the best answer
Keeping everybody on the same page during the end-to-end build process
Launching new features into market that move the customer experience and business forward

We are trying to solve some of the toughest problems in financial technology:

How can we make the loan process more transparent and understandable to the customer?
How do you build a platform so easy to use that a partner agent with zero financial literacy can walk one of her customers through a loan application and repayment process?
How can we drive additional simplicity into our technology stack while not sacrificing flexibility for each of our highly-valued and unique partners?

We have ambitions to change the world of lending and we are looking for the best product talent to help us achieve our goals. We have no egos, we reward performance, and we’re growing so quickly that you will soon feel like an old-timer.
Examples of some recent projects where we would have used your talents:

De novo build of our online direct to consumer application and account center
Creation of a mobile image upload webapp that ensures customers fulfill all our application documentation requirements to move through the loan application process expediently
Event-triggered messaging framework that automatically sends personalized text messages and e-mails based on application and loan behavior

The team is growing quickly. Highly talented and motivated employees will have the opportunity to help shape the direction of the Insikt’s
organization. At Insikt, we are inspired by our mission to promote financial inclusion and driven to change the way credit is accessed. Join us and help us grow!

Our mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
As a Product Manager at Indeed, you will collaborate with engineers, data scientists and other relevant functions to help Indeed better measure and deliver value to job seekers and employers. You will be part of a team with an ambitious vision to help people get jobs in new ways. This is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about how data can help build positive experiences and solve hard problems impacting millions of people.

You will be responsible for setting big goals that inspire and motivate the team while leading by example. You, not the CEO or the VP of Product, will define success and the process for achieving it.

Product development at Indeed is an iterative process. We challenge ourselves every single day to look for insights in our data, generate insightful hypotheses about our users and their needs, and run simple tests to check our hypotheses and learn about what to do next. We are fans of minimum viable process and operate using lean startup and agile principles to guide us. We would prefer to spend time simplifying a feature to get it out the door this week than building flashy powerpoint decks for all hands meetings.

About you:
We're not looking for someone who meets a set of requirements exactly. We're more interested in what unique insights you’ll bring to our team in a few key areas.


You have 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally on teams building platforms or data science infrastructure. We build products based on data, hypotheses, and MVPs, not on our opinions or our seniority. We want you to contribute in the same way.
You have experience formulating hypotheses, then designing, running, and analyzing A/B tests to validate them. You have a practical understanding of good experimental design and statistical concepts related to hypothesis testing.
You are comfortable using programming tools to explore data when necessary because you ask questions that can't always be answered using analytics dashboards. We use lots of Python and relational database concepts here, but the specific tools are less important than your ability to extract insights from challenging data.
You have expertise in at least a few machine learning or data mining arenas, and familiarity with many others. You don’t need to implement models from scratch or have formulas memorized, but you should be able to clearly explain concepts like precision and recall or cross validation to non-experts.
You have strong interpersonal skills. Data is how we make decisions here, but we believe that collaboration, teamwork, and communication are critical to that process. Evangelizing our platform across multiple teams at Indeed, gathering requirements and prioritizing customer needs will be a strong component of your success.

Who we are:
MasterClass is a quickly growing VC-funded startup, based in San Francisco, that is re-imagining online education. We want it to be possible for anyone in the world to learn from the very best. We are creating online classes taught by famous masters—Serena Williams, James Patterson, Annie Leibovitz, Usher and many more to come. The classes combine consumable video content, interactive assignments, and social interaction with the MasterClass community and the masters themselves.

Are you a product manager interested in creating the best educational platform on the planet? We are codifying the indefinable; deconstructing what makes an actor able to cry on demand, or how an athlete or dancer defies gravity. In this role you will have the opportunity to help shape the company and the product, working with every aspect of our process. Ideally, you are excited about creating an online education experience that transcends the passive e-learning models popular today.

We launched in May 2015 and are looking to grow our team. Apply now to find out more about what we are doing behind the scenes.

What we are looking for:

Track record of building great consumer products
Strategic problem-solving skills and data-driven decision-making abilities
Consistent track record of making great decisions after weighing all the factors that must be considered (experience, brand, business impact, technical impact, etc.)
Ability to analyze user data and extract business requirements from multiple stakeholders and transform them into usable and elegant product specifications
Deep empathetic understanding of user experience and user research
Knowledge and passion for education, online experiences and brand growth (from scratch!)

Responsibilities of the role:

Ownership of features and/or products
Drive product strategy forward
Collaborate with design, engineering, and business leads on product flows and aesthetics
Manage UX testing and optimization solutions
Write detailed user stories, identify edge cases, and work with the engineering team to roll out features in an agile, continuous deployment environment

Slack is seeking a product manager on our Lifecycle team to lead product efforts to streamline the purchase experience. Responsibilities

Develop the product strategy and roadmap to improve the purchase experience (e.g. checkout, billing infrastructure, and localization) and to reduce paid churn (e.g. paid features adoption).
Become an authority on your product area and identify areas of opportunity through research and data.

Own features and experiments end-to-end, including writing product specs, driving cross-functional execution, making thoughtful product decisions, and sharing insights and results throughout the company.

POSITION DESCRIPTION/OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN CLOROX:
Clorox Product Management -- Professional Products: Clorox Product Management is a driving force in the development and marketplace success of our brands in the B2B space. As business managers, Clorox Product Management teams are responsible for maximizing the volume and profitability of their respective brands, partnering closely with Sales and Research & Development.

Marketing is the growth engine of Clorox. We believe in creating winning ideas that constantly renew customer and end-user value and energize our brands and businesses in the Professional market. We believe our end-users are at the center of everything we do, and our Product Management Groups drive passion for our end-users and its translation to business results. As a Product Manager, you will be expected to be visionary leaders, to operate with a general management mindset, to focus on the creative and the original -- in order to drive your business and brand with consumers.

Healthcare Product Management Position: As a member of the Professional Product Division, the Healthcare Product Manager has diverse responsibilities that include:

Contributing to the development of the brand's strategies and annual business plans

Working with Creative, PR and Media partners and agencies to develop and implement integrated marketing plans

Identifying product improvement and innovation ideas - Marketing and business lead on New Product Development teams

Working with Clorox R&D and Technical Solutions to stay abreast of the most recent clinical and scientific evidence and apply the science to the business and marketing plans

Developing impactful Sales collateral and tools to enable selling in the field

Performing business and competitive analysis to strengthen the brand's plans to drive sales and profit

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Thought/People Leadership

End-User Insight and Judgment

Critical Thinking and Decision Making

Results Focus

Collaborative Team Skills

Communication

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS (AMM): MBA, with 4 to 5 years pre MBA work experience. Prior Healthcare experience preferred. Other qualifications include: a demonstrated record of achievement, outstanding leadership skills, and strong analytical/problem solving abilities.

U.S. Candidates: Only those candidates with a sincere interest in relocating to the San Francisco Bay Area should apply. Candidates must present, upon employment, proof of U.S. citizenship or legal right to regular employment in the U.S. Note: It is the policy of the Marketing organization with The Clorox Company and its affiliates not to employ students in practical training immigration status or persons with other employment-based non-immigrant visa status in regular positions.

UNIQUE FEATURES OF THE WORK ENVIRONMENT/LIFESTYLE:
One of the great advantages of working at Clorox is our location. In Marketing, we leverage our Bay Area location to drive innovation and progress in our function. In our personal lives, the mild year-round weather and abundance of activity in the San Francisco Bay Area allow us to keep our work and personal lives in perspective. Though we clearly work until the job is done, that does not mean we don't leave time to take advantage of activities that range from biking and skiing to theater and restaurants. To enable us to enjoy our surroundings even further, Clorox has initiated a very progressive work schedule between Memorial Day and Labor Day. During this time our offices close at 12:30pm on Fridays. Clorox also endorses other work options for employees who seek added flexibility in order to meet today's lifestyle requirements. Employees can work with their managers to negotiate flexible arrangements (e.g. telecommuting, job sharing, etc.) as long as they meet the requirements of that person's job. Clorox also fosters a close working environment for the diverse people we employee -- from corporate sporting events to a wide variety of Employee Resource Groups to opportunities for leading department-level social events, there's something for everyone.

Management Training/Orientation Programs for MBAs:
We believe in developing marketers who are equipped to build brands and businesses. This focus on people manifests itself in individualized development plans and on the job coaching, a growth culture focused on driving out waste and increasing agility, and rotations through roles that stretch and challenge individual capabilities (for example, Product Managers can rotate to innovation roles or more customer-facing positions). Our strong training program also means that new marketers are set up for success from day one at the company. Business management skills are specifically developed through an orientation to each of the company's functional areas, and training seminars in topics such as business analysis, forecasting, advertising, and interpersonal communication.

More about Clorox

The Clorox Company (NYSE: CLX) is a leading multinational manufacturer and marketer of consumer and professional products with 8,700 employees worldwide and fiscal year 2018 sales of $6.1 billion. In addition to our namesake bleach and cleaning products, we market some of the most trusted and recognized consumer brand names, including:

Brita® water-filtration products

Burt's Bees® natural personal care products

Fresh Step® cat litter

Glad® bags, wraps and containers

Hidden Valley® dressings and sauces

Kingsford® charcoal

Liquid Plumr® clog removers

Pine-Sol® cleaners

RenewLife® digestive health products

Rainbow Light®, Natural Vitality®, Neocell® and Stop Aging Now® dietary supplements

Professional services: Clorox Healthcare® and Clorox Commercial Solutions®

More than 80% of our sales are generated from brands that hold the No. 1 or No. 2 market share positions in their categories.

Making a positive impact

Clorox is a signatory of the United Nations Global Compact, a community of global leaders committed to sustainability. We've been broadly recognized for our corporate responsibility efforts, most notably being named to the Drucker Institute's 2017 Management Top 250 list, The Just 100: America's Top Corporate Citizens list, CR Magazine's 2018 Best Corporate Citizens list and the first sector-neutral Bloomberg Gender Equality Index in 2018.

We also support our communities, and, in FY2017, contributed $11 million in combined cash grants, product donations and cause marketing.

The Clorox Company and its subsidiaries is an EEO/AA/Protected Veteran/Disabled/LGBT employer.

The Change.org Fellowship Program supports a diverse group of aspiring product managers and engineers who are passionate about making a difference in the social impact and tech industries. This initiative aims to embrace the capabilities, innovation and insights of those who don’t often get an equal shot at professional opportunities in the tech sector, including at companies like ours.

This is a six-month, paid fellowship, for people who have roots in or deep connections with communities that have faced discrimination or marginalization within the technology sector. We particularly encourage people of color, and those who identify as women or gender non-binary to apply. In the fellowship you’ll be provided with the knowledge, skills, and connections necessary to build a tech career. Fellows will work on our product development team to build software, organize experiments and write content that will help scale the impact of our users. Fellows will also receive coaching and mentoring from an experienced group of product managers, engineers and campaigners who are helping to build the power of everyday people worldwide.

At Change.org, we want to empower people everywhere to create the change they want to see in the world. We believe we can be most effective with a team that broadly reflects the diverse community of 240 million people worldwide who use our tools and services. It’s our responsibility as an online organizing platform to make our tools equally accessible to the communities who could benefit the most.

The Role:
As a Product Manager Fellow in our San Francisco office, you’ll join other fellows and dedicated staff in a 6-month program (with opportunity to transition to full time) designed to give you real world experience, while getting support and mentorship from the team at large. You’ll build experiences and features that affect hundreds of millions of people around the world. You’ll get to meet some of the most inspiring campaigners from around the world, and be motivated by stories of change, big and small.
You should:
Have a passion for our mission to help empower people.
Demonstrate curiosity and a drive to learn.
Have a bias towards action and be results-driven.
Effectively lead and collaborate with a team.
Be comfortable being in a dynamic, changing environment.
Have math and analysis skills advanced enough to evaluate performance.
Be transparent, proactive, and have clear written and verbal communication skills.
Nice to haves:
Proven ability to influence others and focus a group toward a goal.
Experience talking with users and understanding their goals, challenges.
Knowledge of current online experiences and key interactions.
Experience with common development processes.
This is a 6-month opportunity based in San Francisco, CA, USA.

Change.org is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. We encourage applicants of different backgrounds, cultures, genders, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

We’re working for a world where no one is powerless, and where creating change is a part of everyday life. We’re just getting started, and we hope you’ll join us.
Apply for this job

We’re changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we’re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it’s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.

For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.

And that’s just what we’re doing today. We’re thinking about the future, too. With teams working on new modalities, self-driving cars and even urban air transportation, we’re in for the long haul. We’re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.

Minimum 4 years experience delivering successful and innovative products with your fingerprints all over them.

Design sensibility. A deep understanding of and appreciation for good design and user experiences.
Customer obsession. The ability to take on complex product challenges and find elegant, simplifying solutions to avoid making them our users and partner's problems
Finger-tippiness with data. You find a way to get the data you need and whip it into an insightful story with no help. You know how to leverage this data to make decisions without getting stuck in analysis paralysis.
A "Driver" mindset. You are biased toward action, a great collaborator, a master disambiguator/simplifier, and constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery
Grittiness. You never hesitate to roll up your sleeves and tackle something hands-on
A high bar across the board - from your own contributions, to the people you work with, to the products you work on.
Ideally candidate will have Computer science undergraduate degree or equivalent. Technical understanding that spans all levels of abstraction and the systems you'll be building.
A true passion for Uber's mission, our products, and the company's hybrid technology/operations nature.
A never-ending desire to grow and learn.

Our mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
As a Product Manager at Indeed, you will collaborate with engineers, data scientists and other relevant functions to help Indeed better measure and deliver value to job seekers and employers. You will be part of a team with an ambitious vision to help people get jobs in new ways. This is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about how data can help build positive experiences and solve hard problems impacting millions of people.

You will be responsible for setting big goals that inspire and motivate the team while leading by example. You, not the CEO or the VP of Product, will define success and the process for achieving it.

Product development at Indeed is an iterative process. We challenge ourselves every single day to look for insights in our data, generate insightful hypotheses about our users and their needs, and run simple tests to check our hypotheses and learn about what to do next. We are fans of minimum viable process and operate using lean startup and agile principles to guide us. We would prefer to spend time simplifying a feature to get it out the door this week than building flashy powerpoint decks for all hands meetings.

About you:
We're not looking for someone who meets a set of requirements exactly. We're more interested in what unique insights you’ll bring to our team in a few key areas.


You have 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally on teams building platforms or data science infrastructure. We build products based on data, hypotheses, and MVPs, not on our opinions or our seniority. We want you to contribute in the same way.
You have experience formulating hypotheses, then designing, running, and analyzing A/B tests to validate them. You have a practical understanding of good experimental design and statistical concepts related to hypothesis testing.
You are comfortable using programming tools to explore data when necessary because you ask questions that can't always be answered using analytics dashboards. We use lots of Python and relational database concepts here, but the specific tools are less important than your ability to extract insights from challenging data.
You have expertise in at least a few machine learning or data mining arenas, and familiarity with many others. You don’t need to implement models from scratch or have formulas memorized, but you should be able to clearly explain concepts like precision and recall or cross validation to non-experts.
You have strong interpersonal skills. Data is how we make decisions here, but we believe that collaboration, teamwork, and communication are critical to that process. Evangelizing our platform across multiple teams at Indeed, gathering requirements and prioritizing customer needs will be a strong component of your success.

About Uber

We’re changing the way people think about transportation. Not that long ago we were just an app to request premium black cars in a few metropolitan areas. Now we’re a part of the logistical fabric of more than 600 cities around the world. Whether it’s a ride, a sandwich, or a package, we use technology to give people what they want, when they want it.

For the people who drive with Uber, our app represents a flexible new way to earn money. For cities, we help strengthen local economies, improve access to transportation, and make streets safer.

And that’s just what we’re doing today. We’re thinking about the future, too. With teams working on autonomous trucking and self-driving cars, we’re in for the long haul. We’re reimagining how people and things move from one place to the next.
About the Role
We are seeking an experienced and passionate Product Manager with technical depth, product intuition and entrepreneurial spirit to own the user facing experience for Privacy Engineering’s short-term roadmap. You will work closely with our Legal and Policy teams to ensure we holistically consider the regulatory environment and market landscape around privacy, and you’ll have the opportunity to build experiences across all products at Uber and make a global impact.

You should be comfortable in uncharted territory as we build unique privacy technologies and grow user trust. We need your skills and enthusiasm to make it happen.
What You’ll Do
Sit at the intersection of Law, Policy, Business and Engineering.
Define product requirements that factor in user needs and pain points, legal requirements, the policy landscape and business strategy.
Ship products against the Privacy Engineering team’s short-term roadmap, and collaborate with other Product and Engineering teams where necessary.
Align and motivate stakeholders in Legal, Policy and Communications Strategy on a product-level mission and roadmap that builds trust with our users.
Heavily utilize data insights, market and customer research, and your product intuition to continually improve your products.
Identify opportunities for new products that leverage Uber's global scale and build upon its Privacy infrastructure to provide unique and lasting customer value.
Clearly communicate plans, insights, data and results to a spectrum of audiences including executives, legal, policy and other product teams across Uber.
Define and track privacy metrics.
What You’ll Need
Depth, expertise, and pragmatism. You have visionary ideals for user privacy and can apply them in a business environment.
Passion. You’re excited and equipped to share our message on privacy and data protection to our users, the industry, and other experts. You may have given public talks or published blog posts or papers on technical topics.
Leadership. You’re able to educate partners on the privacy impact of product decisions and ensure innovation and data protection coexist. You’re just as comfortable with on the ground privacy challenges as you are driving strategy with executive leadership.
A great teammate. Your product instincts are matched by your humility and willingness to problem-solve with others. You can take the lead and have a great sense of what doing ‘the right thing’ is. You are an enabler not a blocker. You seek to mentor and share your knowledge with others.
Minimum of 4 years experience delivering highly successful solutions in engineering, product management, data analytics or in strategy & operations within a tech company - you're extremely proud of what you've accomplished.
Bonus Points For

A computer science undergraduate degree or other engineering degree equivalent.
Experience with the user and technical challenges faced in Privacy, Trust & Safety or Risk engineering and product teams
About the Team
Privacy Engineering’s mission is to make Uber the industry model for consumer privacy through products and services, standards in product, engineering, policy, and transparent communications.

Desired: Data MiningMicrosoft PowerpointMachine LearningPythonOur mission:
As the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. We need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. We are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.

The team:
We are a rapidly growing and focused product team building the most popular job site on the planet. Every month, over 200 million people count on Indeed to help them find jobs, make it easy to apply, research companies, and connect qualified candidates to their job openings. With product teams in Austin, Tokyo, Seattle, San Francisco, Singapore and Hyderabad, we are improving people's lives all around the world, one job at a time.

Your job:
As a Product Manager at Indeed, you will collaborate with engineers, data scientists and other relevant functions to help Indeed better measure and deliver value to job seekers and employers. You will be part of a team with an ambitious vision to help people get jobs in new ways. This is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about how data can help build positive experiences and solve hard problems impacting millions of people.

You will be responsible for setting big goals that inspire and motivate the team while leading by example. You, not the CEO or the VP of Product, will define success and the process for achieving it.

Product development at Indeed is an iterative process. We challenge ourselves every single day to look for insights in our data, generate insightful hypotheses about our users and their needs, and run simple tests to check our hypotheses and learn about what to do next. We are fans of minimum viable process and operate using lean startup and agile principles to guide us. We would prefer to spend time simplifying a feature to get it out the door this week than building flashy powerpoint decks for all hands meetings.

About you:
We're not looking for someone who meets a set of requirements exactly. We're more interested in what unique insights you’ll bring to our team in a few key areas.


You have 3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally on teams building platforms or data science infrastructure. We build products based on data, hypotheses, and MVPs, not on our opinions or our seniority. We want you to contribute in the same way.
You have experience formulating hypotheses, then designing, running, and analyzing A/B tests to validate them. You have a practical understanding of good experimental design and statistical concepts related to hypothesis testing.
You are comfortable using programming tools to explore data when necessary because you ask questions that can't always be answered using analytics dashboards. We use lots of Python and relational database concepts here, but the specific tools are less important than your ability to extract insights from challenging data.
You have expertise in at least a few machine learning or data mining arenas, and familiarity with many others. You don’t need to implement models from scratch or have formulas memorized, but you should be able to clearly explain concepts like precision and recall or cross validation to non-experts.
You have strong interpersonal skills. Data is how we make decisions here, but we believe that collaboration, teamwork, and communication are critical to that process. Evangelizing our platform across multiple teams at Indeed, gathering requirements and prioritizing customer needs will be a strong component of your success.

ABOUT CARVANA

At Carvana we sell cars, but we're not salespeople. Since 2013, we've been making it our mission to change the way people buy, finance, and sell their cars. We saw a huge problem with how much it can suck to buy a car the traditional way, so we committed ourselves to tackling one of the largest, yet-to-be-disrupted markets in the world—the $1 trillion (yes, that's trillion with a "T") per year U.S. auto market.

Fast forward to 2018. Carvana is a public company on a meteoric growth trajectory. At the same time, we still own less than 1% of our target market, and opportunities still abound to make our products more delightful and optimize the business. We've come a long way, but our future is even brighter than what we've accomplished so far.

With the ability to search thousands of vehicles from our expansive inventory, to high-resolution 360° photographs of our vehicles' interior and exterior, to real-time financing and the ability to complete contracts without visiting the back room of a dealership, we provide a seamless, online car buying experience for consumers that can be completed from their desktop or mobile device. All our vehicles are inspected and reconditioned based on our 150-point certification checklist and come with a 7-day return policy.

We also operate our own logistics network to deliver cars to customers as soon as the next day, as well as offer customer pick-up at our state-of-the-art Car Vending Machine ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oBglPeRuz64 ) locations (yes, you read that right). By putting customer satisfaction at the core of our business, we've built a no-pressure, no-haggle online car buying experience that save our customers time and money.

For more information on Carvana and our mission, sneak a peek at our company introduction video. ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c5dpBRp0-_w )

Carvana's office in Redwood City, CA is growing. Housed here are our mobile apps and customer lifetime value teams, tasked with building landscape-altering car shopping, ownership, trade-in, and upgrade experiences. We are looking for passionate product managers to craft delightful and needle-moving experiences.

We see our post-purchase and mobile experiences as a beacon for the Carvana brand, and we err on the side of big bets. We're intensely analytical and data-driven but our biggest decisions come from the heart. We use intuition and product sense to pick the next mountain and lean, data-driven iteration to scale it to points others can't reach.

You are fanatical about delighting users, moving huge numbers, and seeing your product vision come to life. You love being involved with every step of the process, from market research to customer development to solution design and iteration. You're highly autonomous and capable of taking high-level business problems and quickly developing solutions.

At Carvana you will see your work have an immediate, scaled impact every day in a well-funded and rapidly growing company.

You will analyze data, identify opportunities, work closely with design and engineering to scope releases, write requirements, monitor outcomes, and iterate quickly.

Additionally, you will:

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field is required.
At least 2 years of experience in product management, or a technical degree with 2+ years business education or experience. We're also meeting more experienced PMs and will scale title and responsibilities accordingly.

A positive outlook, humility, and a healthy sense of humor. Read this again if necessary.

Product strategy
